intro: Melampyrum barbatum subsp. kitaibelii, commonly known as the hairy yellow betony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are small, yellowish-orange, and clustered in dense spikes, attracting various pollinators. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name.
